|Contributors=Bisseriex Hélène,De Boissezon Xavier

'''([[Progressive loss of autonomy SDD-031|progressive loss of autonomy]])''''

'''Manual wheelchair:''''

- on prescription by any doctor

- purchase or rental, paid for by the health insurance scheme

- whether or not combined with the prescription of an anti-bedsore cushion


'''Electric wheelchair'''

- requires a trial to validate that the wheelchair is suitable for the disability and is not dangerous, by a PRM doctor + a physiotherapist or occupational therapist

- on simple prescription + trial certificate

- purchase only

- subject to prior agreement with the health insurance, additional financing possible by the MDPH '''([[Situation of disability SDD-345|situation of disability]])''''

- whether or not combined with the prescription of an anti-bedsore cushion

question.title: What is required for the prescription of an electric wheelchair?
question.description: The process for prescribing an electric wheelchair

option_a.title: A trial with a PRM doctor and a physiotherapist or occupational therapist
option_a.description: A trial with a PRM doctor and a physiotherapist or occupational therapist

option_b.title: A simple prescription and a trial certificate
option_b.description: A simple prescription and a trial certificate

option_c.title: A trial with a doctor and a physiotherapist
option_c.description: A trial with a doctor and a physiotherapist

option_d.title: A simple prescription and a trial with a PRM doctor
option_d.description: A simple prescription and a trial with a PRM doctor

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer
